answers.answer: I think you need to address each problem first. For example, can you take iron supplement for your anemia? Can you follow a diet for your diabetes? Can you take birth control to help with the policystic ovaries and depression? I have found that when I was on the pill, my hormones kind of balanced out a lot, so my mood swings were milder and my periods weren't as bad.

YES , I HAVE TRIED SO MANY OPTIONS FOR THIS PROBLEM, MY DIABETES, MY THYROID, I HAVE BEEN TAKING IRON FOR MY ANEMIA EVERY MONTH.I ALSO RECEIVE A SHOT OF VB-12 EVERY MONTH FOR MY PRENICIOUS ANEMIA WHICH HAS BEEN FOR AT LEAST FOR 2 YEARS. MY DIET AND INSULIN PILLS I HAVE BEEN ON FOR 5 YEARS AS WELL AS MY THYROID MEDICINE. I HAVE ALSO TRIED MAY OF DIFFERENT BIRTH CONTROL PILLS STARTING FROM A NORMAL DOSE TO THE LIGHTEST DOSE. I ALSO EVEN TRIED THE DEPROVERA SHOT FOR A YEAR IN A HALF THAT JUST MADE MY DEPRESSION WORSE AND SOMETIMES I WAS SO AGGRIVATED WITH EVERYTHING AND EVERYONE. ALL IN ALL I REALLY JUST CAN'T PUT UP WITH THIS MONTHLY CRAMPS AND CLOTTING WHICH HAVE JUST BEEN GETTING WORSE AS THE YEARS GET ON. SO I STILL HAVE NOT BEEN ABLE TO SLEEP GOOD AT NIGHT OR EVEN SO NOW MY HAIR IS THINING VERY BAD TOO. SO I AM IN A MAJOR DECISION OF DO I GET THE HYSTERECTOMY OR NOT? AS MY GYNE SUGGEST THAT I SHOULD.
A related discussion, pcos was started.

question: I am 33yrs old, and have two children 2 and 12. I have been diagnosed with pocs and hypothroidism, prenicious anemia,diabetes typeII, and depression(all for about 3yrs). Because of all my medical problems I have had terrible ,painful periods, headaches and acne, and boils,over wieght. My Gynecologist suggedted a hysterectomy, what do you think I should do?
title: polycistic ovarian syndrome
